Description: Gold ear-ring tapering into into a hollow hoop (damaged in one place), hammered from sheet metal and soldered together; one of the terminals is formed from a small hoop from the same piece of metal as the ring which has been twisted back around itself; the opposite terminal is a simple twisted wire.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2469)
